means: 猎人用于掩护的假马，借口

sentence.Network_en: The possibility of another stalking horse challenge this autumn cannot be ruled out.
sentence.Network_cn: 今年秋季可能会再次推出一名掩护性候选人出来挑战，不排除这种可能性。

sentence.Network_en: I think the development is a stalking horse for exploitation of the surrounding countryside.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为开发只是一个借口，目的其实是想开采周围农村地区的资源。

sentence.Network_en: But let us see how he likes a stalking horse alongside him.
sentence.Network_cn: 但让我们看看他是如何对付对手的围追堵截的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 2011年4月16日 - 此前,本月初,有外电消息称,谷歌在根据假马(stalking-horse)协议提出了一项报价为9亿美元的竞购方案,如果出现其他的竞购方,则会在6月20日进行公开.

list.abs: 撒切尔夫人最初被外界视为掩护性候选人（stalking horse），但她的竞选经理艾瑞·尼夫其后却认为撒切尔夫人有足够能力击败希斯。 …
CCMP是"掩护马"(stalking horse)竞购方,已发出启动竞购要约,为其他可能的要约做铺垫.Eddie Bauer称,美国银行(BAC.N: 行情)和CIT …
北电表示，诺西将出价6.5亿美元收购北电的CDMA和LTE无线技术业务并将扮演“掩护竞拍者(stalking horse bidder)”的角色。在破产拍 …

means.word_mean: 1. a candidate put forward to divide the opposition or to mask the true candidate
2. something serving to conceal plans; a fictitious reason that is concocted in order to conceal the real reason
3. screen consisting of a figure of a horse behind which a hunter hides while stalking game
4. a horse behind which a hunter hides while stalking game

auth_sentence.content: Saprobes, found in horse manure, grow quickly.

auth_sentence.content: Good luck my friend, horse of a lifetime.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe the cart before the horse is in play.
